content: e a s y pr i n t c o w l by cj brady designs the easy print cowl can be made in one sitting use some of the printed yarn available and you have a beautiful tapestry- look cowl make it in a neck warmer style or make it wider and make it a drapey cowl it s your choice the cowl is crocheted in the round with a simple moss stitch it s crochetd in a spiral so you don t have to step up from row to row the starting edge and the final edge are finished with an easy chain stitch and slip_stitch edging this is truly a fast gift to stitch up for your family and friends and if you knit look for my free easy print hat pattern in my ravelry store getting started abbreviations chain chain yarn 150-190 yards of worsted weight yarn suggested yarn is hobby lobby foundation single_crochet fsc i love this yarn print yarn yarn shown is the color painted canyon and stitch st sunset sky skip skip hook size h 5 0 mm single_crochet single_crochet size size shown is a small the pattern includes instructions for slip_stitch slip_stitch small medium large and the cowl is easily made larger for any width or height dimensions the cowl will measure approximately 9 5 10 5 11 5 inches wide 19 21 23 inches in circumference and 8 inches tall darning needle for sewing in loose ends gauge not critical for this cowl medium gauge is recommended start crocheting set up multiples of 2 fsc 70 84 98 stitches and join in the round or chain 70 84 98 join in the round and crochet one row of single_crochet for 70 84 98 stitches row 1 through completion of main stitch pattern chain 1 skip the first stitch and single_crochet in the next st *chain 1 skip one st single_crochet in the next st* repeat * * across the row when you get back to your initial chain 1 make an single_crochet in this chain 1 *chain 1 single_crochet in the next chain 1 space* and then repeat this sequence and keep going around and around the cowl until you reach 7 5 inches tall then single_crochet in each single_crochet and single_crochet in each chain 1 for one round ending with a slip_stitch in the last single_crochet or chain 1 then proceed to the top edging without breaking the yarn top edging *chain 2 skip one st slip_stitch in the next st* repeat across the row when you return back to your initial chain 2 slip_stitch in the st where you made the initial chain 2 break the yarn bottom edging join yarn to the bottom edge with a slip_stitch *chain 2 skip one st slip_stitch in the next st* repeat across the row and finish with a slip_stitch in the st where you made the initial chain 2 break the yarn finishing sew off all loose ends with a darning
